meanings.definition: The act or process of moving faster or increasing in speed.
meanings.sent1: The car's acceleration was impressive as it zoomed down the road.
meanings.sent2: The acceleration of the train made the passengers feel a sudden push.
meanings.sent3: The acceleration of the snail was so slow that it lost the race.
meanings.sent4: The acceleration of technology in recent years has been astounding.
meanings.sent5: The acceleration of the rocket was so powerful that it left a trail of smoke behind.

meanings.definition: The rate at which velocity changes over time.
meanings.sent1: The acceleration of the roller coaster made my stomach drop.
meanings.sent2: The acceleration of the plane during takeoff was exhilarating.
meanings.sent3: The acceleration of the turtle was so gradual that it went unnoticed.
meanings.sent4: The acceleration of the river's flow after the rain was remarkable.
meanings.sent5: The acceleration of the athlete's speed in the race was impressive to watch.

meanings.definition: An increase in the rate or speed of something.
meanings.sent1: The acceleration of the growth of plants in spring is a beautiful sight.
meanings.sent2: The acceleration of the music tempo got everyone on the dance floor.
meanings.sent3: The acceleration of the clock's ticking seemed to make time fly by.
meanings.sent4: The acceleration of the wind speed during the storm was frightening.
meanings.sent5: The acceleration of the crowd's cheers spurred the team on to victory.
